title: Replacing youtube-dl with yt-dlp
text:
How to use yt-dlp
First of all, I just recently heard about yt-dlp. It was from an Andrej Karpathy tweet where he had downloaded all of Lex Friedman’s podcast episodes and then transcribed them with a new AI model called OpenAI Whisper. He created a site that showed the tools he used and one of them was yt-dlp.
So, I was thinking that this might be a helpful post for me to look back at to see how to use yt-dlp compared to youtube-dl, however, it seems that yt-dlp can be used as a direct drop-in replacement.
The reason I am transitioning to yt-dlp is that I found that it is much faster than youtube-dl for some reason. I’ve not looked into the reasons why but I can download a video or audio file at my full internet speed. Previously, I was only able to download them at around 50KiB/s.
I will post a few aliases that I use for downloading videos, audio, and playlists:
alias ytmusic='yt-dlp -o "~/Downloads/Youtube-dl/%(title)s.%(ext)s" -f m4a `pbpaste`'
alias ytvideo='yt-dlp -o "~/Downloads/Youtube-dl/%(title)s.%(ext)s" -f "bv[height<=720][ext=mp4]+ba[ext=m4a]/b[height<=720][ext=mp4]" `pbpaste`'
alias ytvideo-playlist='yt-dlp -o "~/Downloads/Youtube-dl/%(playlist)s/%(playlist_index)s - %(title)s.%(ext)s" -f "bv[height<=720][ext=mp4]+ba[ext=m4a]/b[height<=720][ext=mp4]" `pbpaste`'
As you can see above using yt-dlp is very simple:

Set the output location, file name, and extension using the -o flag. You can manually set these or use the template arguments.
Set the desired format to download with the -f flag. There are many options available to filter the best quality that you desire.
Finally, paste in the url at the end. As you can see here I am using pbpaste so that I can copy my url from my browser and then when I run my alias it will grab the current clipboard on its own.

When using the playlist alias make sure to copy the link to the actual playlist. It will then create a folder in the location you set and start naming all the files and numbering them sequentially so that you can make sure to watch them in the order of the playlist.
I hope this is helpful to future me at the very least. If you liked what see here please reach out to me on  @drewecherd and let me know. That would be super encouraging. Thanks!

title: Full-body 1hr workout
text:
Here is the flow:

Biceps and legs

Complete the following for a single side then repeat. Do this a total of two times decreasing weight and/or reps slightly if needed the second time through.

Seated concentration curls x10 right arm
Single seated curl to standing wood chopper x15 right arm
Right foot on step, hold weight w/ both hands at chest, twist to the left as your raise your left knee. Keep right leg loaded. x30sec
Right foot on step, weight in right hand, curtsy left foot over step to tap toe on each side. Keep right leg loaded. x30sec


Shoulders and legs

Complete the following for a single side then repeat. Do this a total of two times decreasing weight and/or reps slightly if needed the second time through.

Seated one-arm dumbbell press x10 right arm.
Single seated one-arm dumbbell press, stand then sit. x15
Lay on step with weight elevated in right hand, sit up while keeping weight elevated, lower and press weight and lay back down. x15
Russian twists with weight on step x30sec
Lay on step, hold weight with both hands at chest and do a bicycle with weight moving toward knee that is up. x30sec


Chest and legs

Repeat the following twice.

Lay on step and do dumbbell bench press x10
Lay on step and do a wide dumbbell bench press followed by a narrow press with elbows next to your sides. x15
Lay on step and raise legs to table top position. Do a fly while alternating extending one leg. x15
Drop weights, reach above your head to hold the step. Extend and raise straight or slightly bent legs. x30sec
Continue holding step and hold legs vertically. Press your heels to the ceiling while raising your hips off the step. x30sec


Back and legs

Repeat the following twice

With heavier weights do dumbbell dead lift x10
Lower into dead lift position and do x10 rows
With lighter weights in same dead lift position do reverse fly x10
While using one dumbbell stood on end on the floor for support stand on your right leg and bend over to hold the weight. Extend your left leg straight back and point your toes. Tap your toe to the floor and raise your straight left leg to hip height. x30sec.
Maintain the same position. Hold left leg at hip height and bend knee. Pulse your heel toward the ceiling while not dropping your thigh below hip height. x30sec

title: About This Blog
text: I enjoy finding solutions to problems and helping others see how they can solve their own problems. This blog is a place for me to document what I’m learning and perhaps, if I do it well, help others learn a thing or two. If anything you see here is helpful in any way I’d love to hear about it. Connect with me on Twitter.
